properties.name: citation
properties.sdo_desc: A citation or reference to a creative work, such as a publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

properties.name: dateCreated
properties.sdo_desc: The date on which the BiologicalEntity was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

properties.name: dateModified
properties.sdo_desc: The date on which the BiologicalEntity was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

properties.name: datePublished
properties.sdo_desc: Date of first broadcast/publication.

properties.name: distribution
properties.sdo_desc: A downloadable form of this entity, at a specific location, in a specific format

properties.name: hasPart
properties.sdo_desc: Indicates a BiologicalEntity that is (in some sense) a part of this BiologicalEntity. Inverse property: isPartOf.

properties.name: isBasedOn
properties.sdo_desc: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html. Supersedes isBasedOnUrl.

properties.name: isPartOf
properties.sdo_desc: Indicates a BiologicalEntity that this BiologicalEntity is (in some sense) part of.  Inverse property: hasPart.

properties.name: location
properties.sdo_desc: Position where this entity is located or originates from (e.g. an entity from Polynesia islands or an Anatomical location. If multiple locations with multiple purposes (collection, storage) should be modelled, please use the additionalProperty from Place to specify this.

properties.name: measurementTechnique
properties.sdo_desc: To describe the process used to obtain a biological entity or which is associated with that entity (i.e procedure to obtain it or measure/characterise it)

properties.name: isMentionedIn
properties.sdo_desc: CretiveWork, Dataset, collection mentioning this entity  Inverse of:mentions

properties.name: additionalProperty
properties.sdo_desc: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.

properties.name: alternateName
properties.sdo_desc: An alias for the item.

properties.name: description
properties.sdo_desc: A description of the item.

properties.name: identifier
properties.sdo_desc: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details. Recommendation: identifiers.org whenever possible

properties.name: image
properties.sdo_desc: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

properties.name: name
properties.sdo_desc: The name of the item.

properties.name: sameAs
properties.sdo_desc: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

properties.name: url
properties.sdo_desc: URL of the item.

properties.name: associatedDisease
properties.sdo_desc: Disease associated to this protein feature

properties.name: biocoordinates
properties.sdo_desc: Coordinates in a 1 or 2D space, for instance length/coordinates in a sequence.  Usage (example): Use a QuantitativeValue with properties minValue and maxValue for a region or value for a site in a Protein. Use it only with value for a protein length.

properties.name: biologicalType
properties.sdo_desc: List with types preferably supported by BioSchemas-> enumeration list of values maintained on a wikipage (cf accessibilityAPI in schema.org for implementation). If the value is not on the list then the data will still be parsed but only generic properties will be validated. {population,individual,tissue,cell,molecule,protein,nucleic acid}

properties.name: crossReference
properties.sdo_desc: A pointer to another, somehow related entity. Usage: Whenever isBasedOn/isBasisFor, isPartOf/hasPart, citation or any other more specific does not work.

properties.name: isBasisFor
properties.sdo_desc: A resource for which this resource has been used for the creation of the former.  Inverse property: isBasedOn

properties.name: phenotype
properties.sdo_desc: To associate a biological entity to phenotypic information , whether the entity presents the phenotype or causes it.

properties.name: representation
properties.sdo_desc: Representation of this entity. For instance, chemical structure or sequence

properties.name: sample
properties.sdo_desc: Clarify usage...

properties.name: taxon
properties.sdo_desc: A url pointing to NCBI Taxonomy or a taxonomic resource

name: ProteinStructure
subtitle: Bioschemas specification describing the usage of BiologicalEntity for the “protein” biological type.
description: This protein structure specification presents the usage of the generic type BiologicalEntity for the biological type “protein structure”. The biological type makes use of additionalProperty so please read carefully the extra documentation provided here for the correct and expected usage of that property. Please be aware that “protein structure” is NOT a schema.org type but a BiologicalEntity profile.
